An outsider welcome back on traveling corresponded comedian Tom Papa in a second we caught up in America are you there Tom I'm here crafts
That was a beautiful song it was fun listening to it from inside this parking garage
When I'm ready to go on behalf of fly from here I'm resuming my journey across the country sharing the good stories of our fellow Americans
This week I traveled to Buffalo New York along Lake Erie were the sky was cloaked in a constant gray missed allowing for just occasional peaks of the colorful leaves
The forecast was calling for the first snow fall of the year but for the good people of buffalo that's not even cause to wear a long sleeve shirt when you live in Buffalo complaining about the weather is complaining about life itself
I was picked up at the airport by a woman named Charlie she's been driving for twenty two years in her cab was filled with stuffed animals
They lined the dashboard hung from the rear view mirror and the monkey was attached to the steering wheel these are my co pilot she said some people have Jesus I have these guys
She goes by Charlie because her father was hoping she'd be a boy I really think the name made me a bit of a tomboy when I was younger
They don't say tomboy anymore now everybody is filled with gender fluids
I guess that was ahead of my time but
Anyway I'm all girl now and everyone still calls me Charlie
After growing up in Buffalo she went to college down in Arizona because I wanted to go to the hottest place I could find but it turns out I'm not built for the desert seems more like a place for lizards
People who stay there too long start to look like a sponge that was left out in the sun she came home after school and it's been in Buffalo ever since we have a lot of moisture here and I love it I'm like a plant water
Me and I grow when it's not raining it's snowing and when it's not doing either we can count on them is from Niagara Falls are you here to see the falls have you ever lied your cab driver about seeing Niagara Falls because he didn't want her to know you planned your entire trip around eating buffalo wings [noise]
I have
To drop me off downtown and I went out looking for a bar if you're looking
For a bar or tavern buffalo is a good place to look they have a lot of them and last call his four AM they say that staying up to open later gives the snow plows time to clear your way home
I entered what looked like one of the older bars in the city covered in lights and years of science coasters stuck to the walls to kind of place where it's always midnight the kind of place that so tired that even the ceiling seems to be hunched over at the end of the bar
The bartender was a big bear of a man named Chris he had a giant beard and big pausing growled while he worked he said that he's been in this bar for Thirty years and then he's
Been there so long he doesn't even smell they're famous buffalo wings any more people come in all the time and they say they smelled them all the way down the street but I don't smell a thing who knows maybe it's me they smell
Eagerly place my water there's something great about eating food that makes a city famous
Addition to whatever natural elements are involved in the water the air the ingredients there's also a pride and the love and his corneas it might sound
Natural elements are involved the water the air the ingredients there's also a pride and love and as corny as it might sound the love the people add makes all the difference have you ever been away from home for so long that you started professing your love for a plate of deep fried chicken wings
I have

I don't understand what everybody's after I mean sure moving to another city might get you a little more money but when you lose from being away from your family is too big of a cost
Everyone complains about their parents until they shell out twenty dollars an hour for a babysitter and then suddenly we're not so
Bad

In the last year they won the state championship this was a different life it's all just a memory now he said just like this will be one day have you ever started to tear up about a bartenders glory years only to realize it was just your eyes watering from a plate of piping hot buffalo wings
I have
